lead_paragraph: A World Health Organization report found that preventable environmental factors accounted for 12.6 million deaths out of 55.6 million in 2012.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Study Links Pollution to Deaths
headline.main: Environmental Factors Like Pollution Cause a Quarter of Deaths, W.H.O. Says

snippet: A World Health Organization report found that preventable environmental factors accounted for 12.6 million deaths out of 55.6 million in 2012.
abstract: World Health Organization report finds that about 12.6 million deaths out of total of 55.6 million globally are caused by preventable environmental factors.
